overview:
Daniel Kimball has more than fifteen years of experience in the technology, telecommunications and services market. A well-known figure in the industry, he founded DNS.com after running the two largest reseller programs in the web hosting industry. His teams have managed over 9,000 resellers in 146 countries. While at Qwest, Daniel ran the largest channel sales territory in the United States.

Dan was Director of Reseller Channels at ModernGigabyte, where he played a significant role in growing the companyâ€™s reseller network and aided in the sale of ModernGigabyte to Parallels in 2007. Prior to DNS.com, Dan was CSO of DNZoom, helping it to become the leading domain name management platform and leading to the companyâ€™s successful acquisition by a group of investors in 2008. Dan has previously managed various direct and indirect sales departments for Qwest, NTT/Verio, Interland, Claranet, and ModernGigabyte, LLC.
